name: Thomas Snell
biography: A house painter, Thomas Snell donated his services to the Cooper Union for 72 years (attributing his longevity and health, in part, to vegetarianism). He eventually joined the school’s select board alongside J. P. Morgan, Charles W. Gould, and others from New York wealthy elite. married, he explained that “Cooper Union is my wife, and her students my children;” this he demonstrated in his will with a $1 million bequest to Cooper Union.
